examples: Things like this take time.
Time is moving on.
The time passed quickly.
Time to bust a move.
The contractor is really taking their time.
words.defineEn: the quantity that is measured in seconds, minutes, hours, etc. using a device like clock
words.defineVi: số lượng được đo bằng giây, phút, giờ, v.v. bằng thiết bị như đồng hồ

examples: The clock said three o'clock.
Set the alarm for 7 o'clock.
The library opens at 10 o'clock on weekdays.
She finishes her piano practice at 7 o'clock.
The restaurant reservation is for 8 o'clock tonight.
words.defineEn: put after the numbers one to twelve to show or tell what time it is, only when it is at that exact hour
words.defineVi: đặt sau các số từ một đến mười hai để hiển thị hoặc cho biết mấy giờ rồi, chỉ khi nó vào chính xác giờ đó

examples: She went halves on gas.
Buses to Oxford run every half hour.
The journey to the airport takes about half an hour.
He never does things by halves.
I bought these shoes at half price.
words.defineEn: either of two equal parts into which something can be divided
words.defineVi: một trong hai phần bằng nhau mà một cái gì đó có thể được chia

examples: The storekeeper changed my dollar bill for four quarters.
The business has already closed the books for this quarter.
The company's new product line contributed to a significant increase in its overall yield for the quarter.
Things are looking good for the company after they revealed their financial results for the quarter.
A: "I managed to get the highest number of sales this quarter!"
The railway line runs right past the house.
The clock says ten past two.
Not a single jot or tittle goes past the eye of the boss without her noticing.
The cat ran right past me and into the house.
His past comes back to hunt him when an old friend returns to his life.
words.defineEn: the time that has passed or gone by
words.defineVi: thời gian đã trôi qua hoặc trôi qua

examples: To turn cartwheels/somersaults.
To save a penalty.
To play the piano/violin/flute.
To call a meeting/strike.
To have a meeting/a party/a concert.
words.defineEn: used to say where someone or something goes
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nói nơi một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó đi

examples: After all, one case of the trots hardly spells disaster.
Every age has its book, after all.
After all, love will find a way.
After all, an electrical brain is smarter than the sum of its parts.
A new broom sweeps clean, after all.
words.defineEn: at a later time than something; in a position that is next in order or importance
words.defineVi: muộn hơn một cái gì đó; ở một vị trí tiếp theo theo thứ tự hoặc tầm quan trọng

examples: Our cat has just had five kittens.
Just click the link below.
That piece of work just rejected my resume for the third time!
Just hold your horses, Bill!
Alan's explanation just muddies the issue!
You nearly gave the game away in the other room.
I nearly fell asleep.
Losing his business nearly broke him.
Tom is nearly always the odd man out.
My mother nearly had kittens when I said I was going to buy a motorbike .
words.defineEn: to a degree that is close to being complete
words.defineVi: đến một mức độ gần như hoàn thành

examples: Better ask teacher about.
I just about busted a gut.
The boss of the failed company is keeping schtum about his role in the disaster.
The plane holds about 300 passengers.
The plane holds about 300 passengers.
words.defineEn: used with a number to show that it is not exact
words.defineVi: được sử dụng với một số để chỉ ra rằng nó không chính xác
